citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC states for
Rabies vaccinations that dogs must be at least 16 weeks old. Medical records indicate that 3 Bassett Hound puppies
(#6655,6656 and 6657) received the Rabies vaccine at approximately 10 weeks of age. Failure to administer required
vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be adequately protected against
disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the schedule
approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to
administer future vaccinations for these animals. Correct by 19-AUG-2025.

The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Seven adult dogs (#3918, #3919, #3967, #3968,
#4254, #4432, #3232) were overdue for the Rabies Vaccination. The facility states that the animals had received the
vaccine this year and were up to date but they did not record that information in the medical record.
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 19-AUG-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). The PVC states for 
Rabies vaccinations that dogs must be at least 16 weeks old. Medical records indicate that 3 Bassett Hound puppies 
(#6655,6656 and 6657) received the Rabies vaccine at approximately 10 weeks of age. Failure to administer required 
vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule may result in animals to not be adequately protected against 
disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct by ensuring all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the schedule 
approved by the Attending Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to 
administer future vaccinations for these animals. Correct by 19-AUG-2025. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Seven adult dogs (#3918, #3919, #3967, #3968, 
#4254, #4432, #3232) were overdue for the Rabies Vaccination. The facility states that the animals had received the 
vaccine this year and were up to date but they did not record that information in the medical record. 
 
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals 
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all 
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and 
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 19-AUG-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
